moves.3. Bc4 h6: A very passive move.  Better is 3...Be7 to look to castle or 3...Nc6 to develop the knight
moves.4. d4: Breaking open the center and freeing the dark-squared bishop.
moves.4... exd4 5. Nxd4 c5: Although it fends off the knight on d4, this move creates a backwards pawn on d6 that white will look to attack and an outpost for a white piece on d5.
moves.6. Nf3 Qe7: Black looks to attack white's e-pawn but blocks the development of black's dark-squared bishop
moves.7. Nc3 g5: An extremely aggressive attack by pushing black's kingside pawns and black will also look to develop his bishop on the a1-h8 diagonal.  This will make blacks king vulnerable in the long-run if he chooses to castle kingside
moves.8. h3 Bg7 9. O-O Nf6 10. Re1 O-O: With no development on blacks queenside, black plays 0-0 even though his pawn structure is shattered on the kingside.  Castling queenside here would most likely have been better for his king's safety
moves.11. b3: Looking to contest the a1-h8 diagonal with Bb2.  White is leading in development
moves.11... Rd8 12. Bb2 Be6 13. Nd5: Taking advantage of the outpost on d5.  Black has to take here 13...Qd7 14. Nxf6+ Bxf6 15. Bxf6 loses a piece
moves.13... Bxd5 14. Bxd5 Nxd5 15. Bxg7 Nf4: Instead of taking back the bishop with 15...Kxg7, black looks to continue his original plan by bull rushing white's kingside.
moves.16. Bb2: White's bishop has a wide-open diagonal peering into black's kingside defenses
moves.17... f6: ? Black misses 17...g4 which would open up white's defenses and threaten the king
moves.18. e5 f5 19. exd6 Qxd6 20. Qxd6 Rxd6 21: Now all of white's pieces are developed and organized for a devastating blow.
moves.22... b6: ?? Better is 22. Rd7 which prevents R1e7+, b6 does not prevent the attack
moves.23. Re1e7+ Kg6 24. g4: Cutting off h5 and looking for mate
moves.24... fxg4 25. hxg4 Nc6: Finally developing all of his pieces but it is too late as mate is inevitable
moves.26. Rg7#: I am trying to become a better player so comments would be much appreciated.  Feel free to annotate any of my games (especially my losses) because I would love to learn where I went wrong and how I can improve.
